Name: Face of a statue
Description: The head is missing behind the ears and the lower ends of the head-dress are also broken off. The face has weak rounded features. The shape of the piece suggests that it is a sculptor's model or a votive offering. A half-length or long wig probably covered the head, certainly not a royal headcloth or Nemes. Ã„OS 14 is therewith a rare example of a sculptor's model of a non-royal person.
